known_issues: Reflective/shiny rendering anomalies persist in Chromium browsers (Chrome/Edge), likely related to card styling/compositing (shadows/filters/transforms).

existing_features.title: Audit and update the solitaire card component styling so cards render without reflection/shine-like artifacts in Chromium browsers (Chrome/Edge) across all piles (stock/back-of-card, waste, foundation, tableau).

Remove or replace any transform-based hover/active visual effects on cards and card containers that could trigger unwanted GPU compositing artifacts, while preserving clear hover/pressed affordances using non-transform styling (e.g., ring/outline/brightness).

Harden global CSS defenses specifically for the card element and its wrappers to disable reflection-causing properties (e.g., -webkit-box-reflect, filter/backdrop-filter, mix-blend-mode, 3D transform settings) without breaking legitimate styling elsewhere.

Verify and, if needed, adjust the Tailwind shadow token used by cards (shadow-card) so it uses a standard, subtle box-shadow that does not trigger reflection-like artifacts in Chromium, and ensure shadow appearance is consistent between face-up and face-down cards.

projectName: Inspect and fix solitaire card styles causing reflective artifacts in Chromium
